name: Mamabear's Potato Salad
description: This potato salad is served at every BBQ, it's a family favorite passed down from my mother. It is time-consuming but worth it...make it a day ahead for best flavor.
recipeIngredient: 1 (30 ounce) jar creamy salad dressing (such as Miracle Whip®)

recipeInstructions.text: Place potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain and let potatoes cool.

Place eggs in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil, remove from heat, and let eggs stand in hot water for 15 minutes. Remove eggs from hot water, cool under cold running water, and peel. Dice the eggs when cool.

Place the bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain the bacon slices on paper towels. When cooled, crumble and set aside.

Dice potatoes into a large salad bowl and mix with crumbled bacon, diced eggs, and salad dressing. Sprinkle top of salad with shredded Cheddar cheese, and mix the salad thoroughly. Season with black pepper. For best flavor, chill salad overnight.

review.reviewBody: Yes it's a 5lb. bag of red potatoes or 20 small ones.

Instead of Miracle Whip I used Hellman's mayonnaise. I did not add the whole amount I folded in a little at a time until it was the consistancy I was looking for. I also added in a good amount homemade DRY ranch dressing mix. Very tasty. My husband says this was even better after dinner as a midnight snack. The longer it sits the better it gets.

I tried this recipe a couple of weeks ago and the whole family loved it! I actually cut the recipe in half because I was afraid my family wouldn't like it. Boy was I ever wrong! They were mad because I didn't make more! LOL...I'll definitely be making again!

I made this recipe for my family bbq and it was a hit! Everyone was asking for seconds and there was none left! What the recipe doesnt mention is how big you cut the potatoes into cubes. about 1in to 1 1/2 in cubes. not too small because when you mix all ingredients together they might mash turning into mashed potatoes. Also my bf and I love bacon so sometimes I make more bacon then the recipe calls for. It does take some time to make but its worth it! We love this tasty cool summer salad.

I'm really not sure how to rate this recipe b/c something seems off w/ either the amount of potatoes or the amount of the other ingredients listed...First I wanna say that this is really good potato salad! I don't ever use Miracle whip for anything but hubby likes it so I thought I'd give it a try. I used 1 bag of baby red potatoes so there wasn't that much there so I'm thinking maybe the submitter means to use a 5# bag of potatoes??? Because I had less potatoes I just eyeballed the ingredients to our liking...I used 4 hard boiled eggs chopped 12oz. cooked crumbled bacon about 1-1-1/2 cups Miracle Whip and about 1 cup of cheese. This was perfect for us. There just seemed to be too much bacon eggs and Miracle Whip for the amount of potatoes called for so as written (b/c the amount of potatoes is not clear) I would probably give this less stars. We enjoyed this and I honestly didn't think it was gonna be that good and was tempted to add some onion but I'm glad I didn't b/c it was yummy and didn't need anyything else. I would make this again! Sorry if I sound confusing but I don't know how else to say it lol. Thanks for sharing.:)

I made this a day ahead. I used Hellman's mayonnaise with a little horseradish and Dijon. We were surprised how good it was without onions but next time will add a little onion. Love the bacon and eggs.
